div.p: Thanks for your interest in the Numbler web service API. The goal of this guide is to help you get up and running with Numbler as quickly as possible!

Hopefully at this point you have already checked out Numbler, created a sheet or two, and perhaps shared a sheet with some of your friends or coworkers. While our first goal with Numbler was to help people collaborate on a spreadsheets, and equally important goal is hooking up sheets with the rest of the information on the web.
div.div: This is where you fit in!
div.p: If you are a developer we want to help you integrate your application or "mash-up" with Numbler. We have developed a dead simple REST based API that enables your code to talk to a web based spreadsheet. It's really simple to use some sample code to help you out you can start using Numbler with only a couple of lines of code.
div.h3: Want to get started? you need:

ul.li: A Numbler account. Create one here.
A Numbler access ID and secret key. Once you have an account you can register for your ID here.

div.p: Right now we have a python SDK available for download. We will be adding additional languages shortly. If you want to contribute a SDK drop us a line!
